definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: It is to be assumed that the information was then passed on to the AQ Khan nuclear proliferation network.
sentences.chinese: 它是假定该资料，然后转嫁到卡迪尔汗的核扩散网络。

sentences.english: The policy emphasizes the prevention of nuclear proliferation and nuclear terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 该政策强调防止核扩散及防范核恐怖主义。

sentences.english: Why cut $648 million from nuclear nonproliferation activities? (One terrorist nuke, assembled from stray ex-Soviet fissile material, can ruin your whole day.)
sentences.chinese: 为什么从防核扩散活动中削减六亿四千八百万美元？

sentences.english: Papers from a recent conference on proliferation-resistance.
sentences.chinese: 取自最近关于抵抗核扩散的研讨会论文。

sentences.english: "Stopping nuclear proliferation cant be addressed purely by conventional diplomacy, " said Sawers.
sentences.chinese: 防止核扩散仅仅通过传统的外交方式是不能解决的。

sentences.english: The anti-proliferation policy Mr Bush put at the forefront of his foreign policy has been a colossal failure.
sentences.chinese: 布什外交领域的反核扩散政策遭到彻底的失败。

sentences.english: there are terrorism that works, there are nuclear proliferation as I said.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主义仍在继续，还有我刚才说过的核扩散问题。

definition: Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons
pinyin: Bu4 Kuo4 san4 He2 wu3 qi4 Tiao2 yue1
Guo2 ji4 Yuan2 zi3 neng2 Ji1 gou4
